title: 111_hr5647
content: The Act is titled the "Responsible COBRA, Unemployment, and Poverty Extension Act" and includes an extension of unemployment insurance provisions. The text chunk discusses amendments to various sections of different Acts related to unemployment benefits, changing dates from June 2, 2010, to September 30, 2010, and from November 6, 2010, to March 1, 2011. The text chunk amends dates related to unemployment benefits from November 6, 2010, to March 1, 2011, and includes funding changes. The effective date is retroactive to the enactment of the Continuing Extension Act of 2010. SEC. 3. Extension and improvement of premium assistance for COBRA benefits. Extension of Eligibility Period for COBRA benefits under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 is amended to extend from May 31, 2010, to September 30, 2010. Additional rules are added for individuals experiencing a qualifying event related to termination of employment on or after June 1, 2010. The amendment extends the eligibility period for COBRA benefits under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 from May 31, 2010, to September 30, 2010. Rules similar to those in paragraphs (4)(A) and (7)(C) apply to continuation coverage for individuals experiencing a qualifying event related to termination of employment on or after June 1, 2010. The effective date of the amendments is retroactive to the provisions of section 3001 of division B of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009. SEC. 4 extends the use of 2009 poverty guidelines from May 31, 2010, to September 30, 2010. SEC. 5 rescinds $27 billion from unobligated funds under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 to offset spending increases. SEC. 6 requires the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to report the amounts rescinded to congressional committees. SEC. 6. DETERMINATION OF BUDGETARY EFFECTS. The budgetary effects of this Act will be determined by the latest statement submitted by the Chairman of the House Budget Committee. The Act is designated as an emergency for pay-as-you-go principles and statutory paygo requirements.
